relation: Very safe. I have never heard of any problems. Nothing has happened while I have attended. I have also known about ABAC for a long time and never heard anything before attending either.
Tifton is not a very big town, but it is still decent size. There are many places to go out to and visit.
There are a lot of clubs and activities that one can get involved in on campus.
I don't eat there a lot, but the times that I have the food is phenomenal.
I don't live on campus. But I have been to the dorms. They have new buildings for freshman and they looked great.

If you have any questions do not hesitate to ask. I always had a problem with asking people for help, but I had to get over that. Now, if I have a question I simply ask someone, and they answer it or direct me to someone who can answer it.
Staff is really attentive and willing to help out. It is a very friendly and homelike environment. Everything is very accessible here.
pageTitle: Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {217337=Abac hosts different events depending on what time a month it is. Most of the events are hosted at place, the Town Hall Classroom. For example; in the month of November they hosted No Shave for Men, which is for prostate cancer, October, the hosted an event for alcohol, which was for Red Ribbon Week., 43973=The Polar Bear Plunge into the pool in the middle of January. The water is always frrezing but it's just a fun thing to do and a good way to meet new people!, 49737=There really isn't much to do in Tifton for fun. Thursday nights is the ABAC night at the Gin, the local bar. Also on Thursday nights Applebee's hosts a karaoke night and a lot of the ABAC students go. Also if you're into rodeo the fraterinties often hold barrel races at the arena and the Annual Homecoming Rodeo is in March each spring., 25896=Every year, we have the Hispanic Heritage Day festival in September where organizations perform different Latin cultural dances and representations of Latin American countries., 44313=There is a swimming pool on campus as well as two fitness gyms that are free to the college students. There are also horse stables on campus and a lake for fishing. The school has many events and activities going on for students to do in their spare time. There is also a bowling alley in town and a fair in November., 225919=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 191059=Dinning hall is open from M-F 7:30 am to 7:30 pm, S-Su 11:30 am to 6:30 pm. Food is delicious salad bar, sandwiches, pizza, and hamburgers all day.}
textBeforeTable: 12/10/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 6 out of 10 people found this review useful. 1 person found it offensive. 1 person found this inaccurate. 1 of 51 Louis from Lawrenceville, GA Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Yes you get more than what you paid for when you attend this college. The food is great and it's all you can eat. Am enjoying being here This college is for everybody. Only been here for one semester and already loving it. The staff and faculty is nice and they will do anything to help you. Love the activities. Enjoyed especially the social events. Am learning a lot I have learned a lot from the student here by just talking to them. Everybody here will talk with you like they known you for years. Login to rate or flag the reviews Elaine from Mcdonough, GA 10/09/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 51 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Great for anyone - there's no one specific group of people that enjoy
